title: (x) North Sea --1944 NYT - hand lettered {Luke Seiben (self)}
content:
Whoa 'billygene'! The poster acknowledged it was hand drawn and just wanted to know if anything else was close. Your rude tone isn't necessary or appreciated. We try to help folks here, not pounce on them for honest questions.   
   
An italic like [Berkeley Old Style](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124723/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-berkeley-old-style/itc-berkeley-oldstyle-book-italic/testdrive.html?s=North%2BSea&p=48) is a bit neater, but has some of the same feel, perhaps. You might also find some hand-drawn fonts that could come close enough. Check Part 6, Part 8 or Part 11 of the [Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124723/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptIDGuide.html) for possibilties.
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
Most of the [Ingrimayne Type serif fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124723/http:/www.myfonts.com/Search?searchtext=ingrimayne%20serif&itemsperpage=36&resultcount=36&page=1), like [Youbee](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124723/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/youbee/italic/testdrive.html?s=North%20Sea&p=48) and   
 [Better Ingriana](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124723/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ingrimayne/better-ingriana/italic/testdrive.html?s=North%20Sea&p=48), have a hand drawn look to them.
